instruction: Create a Blueprint that on begin play waits 0.5s then prints 'Step 1', waits 0.5s then prints 'Step 2', waits 1.0s then prints 'Step 3', waits 3.0s then prints 'Step 4'.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelaySequence
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=0.5]
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Step 1"]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=0.5]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Step 2"]
NODE n6: Delay [Duration=1.0]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Step 3"]
NODE n8: Delay [Duration=3.0]
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Step 4"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Completed -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
EXEC n8.Completed -> n9.Execute

instruction: Create a health system Blueprint with 150 max health. It should take 10 damage when hit and destroy the actor when health reaches zero.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthSystem
PARENT: Actor
CATEGORY: Gameplay

VAR CurrentHealth: Float = 150
VAR MaxHealth: Float = 150

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="TakeDamage"]
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=CurrentHealth]
NODE n3: SubtractFloat [B=10]
NODE n4: ClampFloat [Min=0.0, Max=150]
NODE n5: SetVar [Variable=CurrentHealth]
NODE n6: LessEqualFloat [B=0.0]
NODE n7: Branch
NODE n8: DestroyActor
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Damage Taken"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.True -> n8.Execute
EXEC n7.False -> n9.Execute

DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Value [Float]
DATA n5.Value -> n6.A [Float]
DATA n6.ReturnValue -> n7.Condition [Bool]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on begin play waits 2.0s then prints 'Step 1', waits 0.5s then prints 'Step 2', waits 0.5s then prints 'Step 3', waits 0.5s then prints 'Step 4'.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DelaySequence
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Delay [Duration=2.0]
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Step 1"]
NODE n4: Delay [Duration=0.5]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Step 2"]
NODE n6: Delay [Duration=0.5]
NODE n7: PrintString [InString="Step 3"]
NODE n8: Delay [Duration=0.5]
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Step 4"]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Completed -> n3.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.Completed -> n5.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute
EXEC n6.Completed -> n7.Execute
EXEC n7.Then -> n8.Execute
EXEC n8.Completed -> n9.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that moves upward every 3.0 seconds using a timer.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TimerLoop
PARENT: Actor

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: SetTimerByFunctionName [FunctionName="OnTimer", Time=3.0, bLooping=true]
NODE n3: Event_CustomEvent [EventName="OnTimer"]
NODE n4: AddActorLocalOffset [DeltaLocation=(Z=1.0)]

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that activates a special ability when the player presses the F key.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_UseAbility
PARENT: Character

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="UseAbility"]
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="UseAbility activated"]
NODE n3: CallFunction [FunctionName="ExecuteUseAbility"]

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that checks if health is above 50. If true, it prints 'Condition Met'. If false, it destroys the actor.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ConditionalHealth
PARENT: Actor

VAR Health: Float = 50.0

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: GetVar [Variable=Health]
NODE n3: GreaterThan [B=50.0]
NODE n4: Branch
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Condition Met"]
NODE n6: DestroyActor []

EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
EXEC n4.True -> n5.Execute
EXEC n4.False -> n6.Execute

DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Condition [Bool]

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a ParticleComponent that toggles visibility when the player presses the "Switch" input action.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleParticle
PARENT: Actor

VAR bIsVisible: Bool = true

GRAPH: EventGraph

NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Switch"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetVisibility [Target=ParticleComponent, NewVisibility=true]
NODE n4: SetVisibility [Target=ParticleComponent, NewVisibility=false]

EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute
